snippet: New York has nothing to prove, and officials made the right decision to cancel the marathon after Hurricane Sandy, although it was 72 hours too late.
abstract: George Vecsey Sports Of The Times column expresses support for decision to cancel the New York City Marathon in wake of Hurricane Sandy; contends that choice should have been made decisively, and earlier, once extent of suffering had become clear.
lead_paragraph: New York has nothing to prove, and officials made the right decision to cancel the marathon after Hurricane Sandy, although it was 72 hours too late.

headline.seo: George Vecsey: Canceling the Marathon Was the Right Thing to Do
headline.main: Wisely Stepping Aside in a Bombarded City
headline.print_headline: Wisely Stepping Aside In a Bombarded City
